title: Tawny-backed fantail
text: The tawny-backed fantail ("Rhipidura superflua"), also known as the cinnamon-backed fantail, is a species of <a href="bird">bird</a> in the family <a href="Rhipiduridae">Rhipiduridae</a>. It is <a href="Endemism">endemic</a> to <a href="Buru">Buru</a> island in <a href="Indonesia">Indonesia</a>. Its natural <a href="habitat">habitat</a>s are subtropical or tropical moist lowland <a href="forest">forest</a>s and subtropical or tropical moist <a href="montane%20forest">montane forest</a>s. The species occupies an area of larger than 20,000 km2 and has a stable population of above 10,000, and thus is not considered as threatened.
